dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4543 IH: Medicaid Breast Cancer Access to Treatment Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Waters (for herself, Ms. Garcia of Texas, Ms. Norton, Ms. Velázquez, Ms. Wasserman Schultz, Mrs. Dingell, Ms. Clarke of New York, Mr. Fields, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Ms. Tlaib, Mr. Thompson of Mississippi, Ms. Sewell, Mr. Gottheimer, Mrs. Watson Coleman, Mr. Thanedar, Ms. Lee of Pennsylvania, Mr. Latimer, Ms. Wilson of Florida, Mr. Veasey, Mr. Cohen, Mr. Lynch, Mrs. McIver, Mr. García of Illinois, Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick, Ms. Moore of Wisconsin, and Mr. Costa) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to require coverage for certain individual with breast or cervical cancer under the Medicaid program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Medicaid Breast Cancer Access to Treatment Act.

section.header: Requiring Medicaid coverage for certain individuals with breast or cervical cancer under the Medicaid program

subsection.text: Section 1902 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a) is amended—

clause.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking and (30) and inserting (30), and (32);

subclause.text: in subclause (VIII), by striking or at the end;
in subclause (IX), by adding or at the end; and
by adding at the end the following new subclause:
who are described in subsection (aa) (relating to certain breast or cervical cancer patients);

clause.text: in clause (ii), by striking subclause (XVIII); and

subparagraph.text: in the matter at the end, in subdivision (XIV), by striking subparagraph (A)(10)(ii)(XVIII) and inserting subparagraph (A)(10)(i)(X); and
by redesignating paragraphs (3) and (4) as paragraphs (1) and (2), respectively; and
in paragraph (2), as so redesignated, by inserting as in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, after (42 U.S.C. 300gg(c)),.

subsection.header: Inclusion of breast reconstruction as medical assistance
subsection.text: Section 1905(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396d(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (31), by striking and at the end;
by redesignating paragraph (32) as paragraph (33); and
by inserting after paragraph (31) the following new paragraph:
breast reconstruction following a medically necessary mastectomy; and
Section 1905(b)(4) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396d(b)(4)) is amended by striking section 1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XVIII) and inserting section 1902(a)(10)(A)(i)(X).

subparagraph.text: Subsections (a)(2) and (b)(2) of section 1916 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396o) are each amended—

clause.text: in subparagraph (I), by striking or at the end;
in subparagraph (J), by striking ; and at the end and inserting , or; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: items and services furnished to individuals described in section 1902(aa); and
Section 1916A(b)(3) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396o–1(b)(3)) is amended—

clause.text: in subparagraph (A)(v), by striking 1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XVIII) and inserting 1902(a)(10)(A)(i)(X); and
in subparagraph (B)(viii), by striking 1902(a)(10)(A)(ii)(XVIII) and inserting 1902(a)(10)(A)(i)(X).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply beginning 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act.
